name: champagne

A2 (also Champagne) an expensive white or pink fizzy (= with bubbles) wine made in the Champagne area of Eastern France. Champagne is often drunk to celebrate something: We always celebrate our wedding anniversary with a bottle of champagne. The champagne corks were popping (= bottles of champagne were opened) when Guy got his new job. The cool climate and chalky soil are ideal for producing Champagne. Compare
bubbly noun informal
fizz noun (GAS BUBBLES) UK informal

a fizzy (= with bubbles) wine or drink that looks similar to champagne: There is non-alcoholic elderflower champagne for those that prefer it.
a pale gold colour similar to the colour of champagne: Make your eyes twinkle with neutral eye shadow shades like silver or champagne. This stylish phone is available in chic shades such as smoke, charcoal and champagne.
